fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Of the 160,000 Honda Civic cars made in the Swindon factory last year, about a third, not the vast majority, were for export to the EU (‘Body blow’ as Honda shuts plant in Swindon, 19 February, page 1). • An article said the 12,500 cars that Porsche sold in Britain in 2018 accounted for over a fifth of the company’s global sales. That’s more like 5%; Porsche sold 256,000 cars worldwide (Porsche warns UK buyers of a 10% no-deal surcharge, 16 February, page 4). • Other recently corrected articles include: Alastair Campbell: Radio 4’s Today should be less middle class Cousin marriages cited as significant factor in Bradford child deaths Baftas 2019: The Favourite reigns – almost – supreme as Roma takes best picture How Snow White and some coconuts killed 1989’s Oscars
